benchmark_details.name: RPEval (Role-Playing Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: RPEval is designed to assess LLM role-playing capabilities across four key dimensions: emotional understanding, decision-making, moral alignment, and in-character consistency.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reproducible evaluation method for the role-playing capabilities of Large Language Models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Focus on single-turn interactions limits assessment of nuanced, long-term role-playing attributes.

data.source: Generated character profiles and scenarios using OpenAIâ€™s GPT-4o.
data.annotation: Crowdsourced responses from participants using an online platform.

metrics: Binary scoring for performance across core dimensions
methodology.calculation: Scores are given based on correctness of emotional recognition and alignment with the character's decisions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better role-playing ability across specified dimensions.
methodology.baseline_results: Average scores calculated for evaluated models include GPT-4o (44.41%), Gemini-1.5-Pro (62.24%), and Llama 3.2 1B (39.33%).
methodology.validation: Multiple test runs for each model were conducted to assess performance stability.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for misuse through manipulation of role-playing scenarios.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Anonymity measures implemented in crowdsourced responses.
